Description: Stem and tondo sherd of Attic red-figured pottery type A cup; slight fillet on stem with scraped grooves to either side. Interior: red-figure decoration consisting of neck, torso, part of arms, and legs of nude male figure moving to right, looking back, with left arm lowered; part of undetermined motif beside his left arm; exterior glazed; inside of stem glazed save for top; underside reserved with central dot and circle and two bands.
Findspot: Excavated/Findspot: Naukratis (according to G&R Department register)
Curator's comments: On a broken surface the ghost of lettering 'XV', presumably modern. Probably akin to the lettering on 1934,1105.3, which is likely to have been found at Orvieto (Williams).
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.0645) (Phase 1)
